subject: Re: [junit] About Parameterized Test Runner
msgSnippet: That s what I would do.  If they are related, place them in the same suite. On Fri, Aug 7, 2009 at 9:09 PM, B. Sai Prasad, M.Phil, SCJP, MCP,
messageBody:
That's what I would do. If they are related, place them in the same suite.

On Fri, Aug 7, 2009 at 9:09 PM, B. Sai Prasad, M.Phil, SCJP, MCP,
MCTS, SSGB, PMP, PMI-SP<sai.prasad.b@...> wrote:
> Hi -
>
> I am using parameterized test runner that allows me inject different sets of
> data (from the @Parameters feeder method) to the argument constructor of the
> test case.
>
> Though this is pretty good approach of calling the same test method with
> different data sets, I find it difficult when the test case has multiple
> @Test methods and each test method needs a different data set to assert on.
>
> I am currently solving this by grouping the @Test methods that require the
> same data sets in a test case and moving the other @Test methods to
> different test case.
>
> Am i right?
> Sai
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
